pages.content:
[HEADING] Master of Real Estate
[HEADING] Benefits
[HEADING] Programme Educational Objectives (PEO)
[HEADING] Programme Outcomes
[HEADING] Entry Requirement
The Master of Real Estate (MRE) is accredited by the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS), United Kingdom and ranked No. 20 in the 2022 EDUNIVERSAL BEST MASTERS RANKING (REAL ESTATE MANAGEMENT, WORLDWIDE). The Master of Real Estate equips students with a broad background in real estate investment, appraisal and development. The core modules cover a wide variety of topics including; real estate finance, valuation, development, market analysis and economics.
To produce skilled, knowledgeable and professional graduates in real estate as required by the industry
To produce real estate graduates who are critical, creative and innovative, capable of leading and competitive
To produce real estate graduates who are susceptible to technological, professional and ethical developments and who are responsible to the community and the environment
Graduate will be able to :
Enhance the knowledge of property development to meet academic and industry needs locally and internationally
Apply knowledge and skills in coordinating and managing various types of property effectively
Undertake social responsibility in providing real estate consulting and valuation services
Demonstrate professionalism in implementing property management services to meet the needs of industry and communities
Communicate and work effectively in industry and communities to make investment decisions and property development
Develop analytical capabilities and problem solving skills
Possess relevant information and knowledge in property consulting and valuation services
PROGRAMME DURATION Minimum          : 1 year (2 Semesters + 1 Special Semester) Maximum         : 4 years (8 Semesters)
PROGRAMME STRUCTURE (45 CREDITS)
Semester 1 of the academic year commences in September.https://pgadmission.um.edu.my
Click here for more details.
Last Update: 20/05/2025
• Faculty of Built Environment
• fab@um.edu.my
• +603-79677955
• Home
• Master of Real Estate
• To give opportunity and equip candidates with a better ability in real estate decision making.
• To provide candidates with a broad career prospect in the real estate business, government development projects, research and academics.
• To enhance skills and knowledge of current managers in the real estate field so as to be more focused and competitive in leading the real estate filed.
• To provide opportunity for other relevant professions to improve themselves in the field of real estate by upgrading academic qualification, skills and practice.
• To produce experts in the field of real estate who are sensitive towards a balanced built environment development.
• Core Courses (39 credits)Research Methodology in Real EstateResearch ProjectDevelopment Economics and PlanningProperty Law and Institutional FrameworkProperty Finance and Investment AnalysisReal Estate Development ProcessProperty Market Research and MarketingValuation and Investment Appraisal
• Research Methodology in Real Estate
• Research Project
• Development Economics and Planning
• Property Law and Institutional Framework
• Property Finance and Investment Analysis
• Real Estate Development Process
• Property Market Research and Marketing
• Valuation and Investment Appraisal
• Any two (2) Elective Courses (6 credits)Corporate Real EstateReal Estate Project ManagementSustainable Real Estate Development
• Corporate Real Estate
• Real Estate Project Management
• Sustainable Real Estate Development
• Research Methodology in Real Estate
• Research Project
• Development Economics and Planning
• Property Law and Institutional Framework
• Property Finance and Investment Analysis
• Real Estate Development Process
• Property Market Research and Marketing
• Valuation and Investment Appraisal
• Corporate Real Estate
• Real Estate Project Management
• Sustainable Real Estate Development
• Real estate development
• Real estate research and consultancy
• Real estate marketing
• Real Estate Investment/ REITs
• Banking Sector
• Property Management
• Other corporate organisations
[HTML_TABLE]
PEO01 | To produce skilled, knowledgeable and professional graduates in real estate as required by the industry
PEO02 | To produce real estate graduates who are critical, creative and innovative, capable of leading and competitive
PEO03 | To produce real estate graduates who are susceptible to technological, professional and ethical developments and who are responsible to the community and the environment
[HTML_TABLE]
P01 | Enhance the knowledge of property development to meet academic and industry needs locally and internationally
P02 | Apply knowledge and skills in coordinating and managing various types of property effectively
P03 | Undertake social responsibility in providing real estate consulting and valuation services
P04 | Demonstrate professionalism in implementing property management services to meet the needs of industry and communities
P05 | Communicate and work effectively in industry and communities to make investment decisions and property development
P06 | Develop analytical capabilities and problem solving skills
P07 | Possess relevant information and knowledge in property consulting and valuation services
